meanings.definition: The quality or state of being gauzy.
meanings.sent1: The gauziness of the fabric made it perfect for a summer dress.
meanings.sent2: She admired the gauziness of the curtains as they fluttered in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved pulling a rabbit out of the gauziness of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The gauziness of the fog enveloped the entire town in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: The delicate gauziness of the butterfly's wings captivated the young child.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is gauzy.
meanings.sent1: The gauziness of the veil allowed just enough light to filter through.
meanings.sent2: The gauziness of the film gave it a dreamy, ethereal quality.
meanings.sent3: The artist used the gauziness of the paint to create a soft, blurred effect.
meanings.sent4: The gauziness of the memory made it difficult to recall specific details.
meanings.sent5: The gauziness of the atmosphere added a sense of mystery to the evening.
